bridge-type.label: XMPP Client
bridge-type.description: A connection to a XMPP server

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: The XMPP Username (the left side of JID, e.g. user for JID user@example.com)

parameter.name: domain
parameter.label: Domain
parameter.description: The XMPP Domain (the right side of JID, e.g. example.com for JID user@example.com)

parameter.name: host
parameter.label: Server Hostname/IP
parameter.description: The IP/Hostname of the XMPP server (if not specified, the Domain will be used)

parameter.name: securityMode
parameter.label: Security Mode
parameter.description: An enumeration for TLS security modes that are available when making a connection to the XMPP server.

channel-type.label: Publish Trigger
channel-type.description: This channel is triggered when a message is received on the configured XMPP account. The event payload will be the received text.

parameter.name: payload
parameter.label: Payload Condition
parameter.description: An optional condition on the value

parameter.name: separator
parameter.label: Separator Character
parameter.description: The trigger channel payload usually only contains the received text. If you define a separator character, for example '#', the sender UID and received text will be in the trigger channel payload. For example: pavel@example.com#My Message Text.
